column4: remove one or the other and see what happens, they might have "collided"
I've seen that happen before
sudo apt-get remove mplayer*
then try totem, see what it does, then if it's cool, ok, if not then add mplayer back
OK I'll pull it *all* out again.
pay attention, just do mplayer, then test totem
then if it's good ok, if not then pull totem and put in mplayer and test, etc...
I've had that issue with 3 different distros
Ok, I missed that line.
Weird thing is... I had all of the imstalled earlier today, and I could at least play non-encrypted DVDs
test each, totem and mplayer, separately, you'll get a trend, then I can help.
No prob, just informing you. Thanks... one sec
(totem:26625): GStreamer-CRITICAL **: how to remove plugins?
what did you type to get that error?
That's the fisr "error". I typed: totem /dev/dvd
type this first, let's get rid of mplayer, I want to see if you have something mixed up... "sudo apt-get remove mplayer*"
and make sure you see that * at the end of that line
ALready removed that
using the code I just gave you? try it again
Let's me use apt-get this time though.
Ok: E: Couldn't find package mplayer*
ok, then just type "totem" in a terminal and see what output it gives you.
Want me to paste the whole output fo pastebin
no, just tell me did you get totem or not?
sudo apt-get install totem-xine
Ok, it opens with only a gtk error, which I've learned to ignore. Happened before.
ok so you now have totem but with an error?
And.. it's playing a non-encrypted DVD, but no sound.
check "alsamixer" first, make sure everything is pumped up, you know this right?
just checking, don't know what you know and don't know...
NP. Yes it's up, almost all the way, and Gaim just bonged as a buddly logged on, about scared me off the couch
ok so sound works, now, let's add mplayer back to the mix "sudo apt-get install mplayer*"
and make sure that * is at the end of that line
And... I ahve a new laptop. 1.7 Ghz, 1 GB Ram, 100 GB HD, All Intel hardware. It's really choppy video, and bogs down the processor.
I'll do that.
it will get there, it's sometimes a matter of "order".
Hmm, that caused a massive dep issue. apt-get crashed

sudo apt-get -f install
2005-11-24T10:35:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	No, mplayer-i386 conflicts with mplayer-k6, and with mplayer-586, etc, etc
2005-11-24T10:36:00.000Z	misfit_toy	PMantis	ok then take the * off the end of that line and try it
2005-11-24T10:37:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	That's a virtual package. I should install mplayer-586 though.
2005-11-24T10:37:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	apt-get install mplayer-586   worked
2005-11-24T10:39:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	Ok, Mplayer plays with sound, but not totem
2005-11-24T10:40:00.000Z	misfit_toy	PMantis	ok so this is how much better than before, have we improved? I need to know that.
2005-11-24T10:40:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	I think so, let me compare to an encrypted DVD I had in earlier. I don't expect it to play, but I want to compare behavior.
2005-11-24T10:41:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	Weird... I can't get this DVD to eject
2005-11-24T10:42:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	I right click, eject. Error.. but icon is gone, nothing shows on mount. but cd tray is locked
2005-11-24T10:42:00.000Z	misfit_toy	PMantis	use a paperclip in the little hole, I've had to do that too when trying to fix this stuff.
2005-11-24T10:43:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	Heh, yeah... never had that with this lappy on Ubuntu. :)
2005-11-24T10:43:00.000Z	misfit_toy	PMantis	prolly a one time thing
2005-11-24T10:43:00.000Z	misfit_toy	PMantis	and you might restart X after this, not reboot, just X
2005-11-24T10:47:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	Ok, yes. it's better than it was when you first started helping. I'm only missing sound on Totem, and css... first things first.
2005-11-24T10:47:00.000Z	PMantis	misfit_toy	But, I can't eject anyting manually... Error: invalid argument". I'll live with that for now until I restart X.
ok, then let me think about that. glad it's better.
reboot, hate to say that but you prolly should
Yes! Thank you so far!!
lol Hey, this is Linux, no reboots. :)
I know, they "say" that...but trust me.
Ok, you're not gonna run and hid are you? ;)
BRB
no
